questions.text: Read the passage carefully and answer the questions given below:
questions.passage: The ultimate challenge is to make your mind calm and the ultimate solution is meditation. For a student, it improves long term performance, health, focus, and concentration. The simplest form is focussing on breathing in a quiet place.

parts.statement: The ultimate challenge these days is to
parts.explanation: The passage clearly states that the ultimate challenge is to make the mind calm.

parts.statement: Meditation helps students

options.text: to improve long term performance in studies

parts.correct_answer: to improve long term performance in studies
parts.explanation: Meditation improves performance, health, focus, and concentration in students.

parts.statement: The simplest form of meditation is
parts.explanation: The passage mentions focussing on breathing as the simplest form of meditation.

parts.statement: The word 'meditation' is
parts.explanation: Meditation is the name of a practice, so it is a noun.

parts.statement: Which word in this passage means 'an ability to keep something in mind'?
parts.explanation: Retention means the ability to keep information in the mind.

questions.text: Answer the questions in about 30 words (any six):

parts.statement: Who or what did Lencho have faith in? What did he do?
parts.explanation: Lencho had complete faith in God. After his crops were destroyed by hailstorm, he wrote a letter to God asking for one hundred pesos.

parts.statement: Why was the young seagull afraid to fly?
parts.explanation: The young seagull was afraid to fly because he thought his wings would not support him and he would fall into the sea.

parts.statement: What does Mandela thank the international leaders for?
parts.explanation: Mandela thanks the international leaders for supporting South Africa in its struggle against apartheid and for witnessing its freedom.

parts.statement: Why was Mr. Keesing annoyed with Anne? What did he ask her to do?
parts.explanation: Mr. Keesing was annoyed because Anne talked too much in class. He punished her by asking her to write essays.

parts.statement: What is the story about the Kodavu people’s descent?
parts.explanation: The Kodavu people are believed to have descended from Greek soldiers or Arabs who settled in India.

parts.statement: What experiment did Maxwell think Causserman would be suitable for?
parts.explanation: Maxwell thought Causserman would be suitable for experimenting with otters as they were easily available in marshes.

parts.statement: What was a source of unending joy for Valli?
parts.explanation: The bus ride to the town was a source of unending joy for Valli.

parts.statement: What does Kisa Gotami ask for the second time she goes from house to house? Does she get it? Why?
parts.explanation: She asks for mustard seeds from a house where no one had died. She does not get it because death had occurred in every house.

questions.text: Answer the following questions in about 30 words (any two):

parts.statement: How does the fog come?
parts.explanation: The fog comes silently and slowly like a cat, covering everything quietly.

parts.statement: What happens to the house when the trees move out of it?
parts.explanation: When the trees move out, the house collapses as it loses support and protection.

parts.statement: What do the ‘crow’ and ‘hemlock’ represent in the poem ‘Dust of Snow’?
parts.explanation: They represent negative things that unexpectedly bring a positive change in mood.

questions.text: Answer the following questions in about 30 words (any two):

parts.statement: What does the thief get from Anil in return for his work?
parts.explanation: The thief gets food, shelter, education, and trust from Anil.

parts.statement: How is Ausable different from other secret agents?
parts.explanation: Ausable is ordinary, calm, and overweight, unlike typical secret agents.

parts.statement: What lesson does Ebright learn when he does not win anything at a science fair?
parts.explanation: Ebright learns that success depends on hard work and original ideas.

questions.text: Answer the following questions in about 75 words (any one):

parts.statement: Why does the postmaster send money to Lencho? Why does he sign the letter ‘God’?
parts.explanation: The postmaster sends money out of sympathy and respect for Lencho’s faith. He signs the letter ‘God’ to preserve Lencho’s belief.

parts.statement: Why does the narrator of ‘The Black Aeroplane’ say he was not sorry to walk away from the Dakota?
parts.explanation: The narrator feels grateful after surviving the storm and landing safely.

questions.text: Answer the following questions in about 75 words (any one):

parts.statement: Write the central idea of the poem ‘The Ball Poem’.
parts.explanation: The poem teaches acceptance of loss and responsibility as part of growing up.

parts.statement: What do ‘desire’ and ‘hate’ stand for in ‘Fire and Ice’? What does Frost say about the end of the world?
parts.explanation: Desire represents greed, hate represents hatred. Frost believes either can destroy the world.

questions.text: Answer the following questions in about 75 words (any one):

parts.statement: Why does Mrs. Hall find the scientist eccentric?
parts.explanation: Mrs. Hall finds him eccentric due to his strange behavior and secrecy.

parts.statement: Why was the twentieth century called the ‘Era of the Book’?
parts.explanation: Because of massive growth in publishing, printing, and reading habits.
